• If you find high radon levels
• Má thagann tú ar ardleibhéil radóin
Radon is a naturally occurring radioactive gas that results from the decay of uranium in rocks and soils
Is gás radaíghníomhach é radón a tharlaíonn go nadúrtha ó lobhadh úráiniam i gcarraigeacha agus i dtalamh
The gas is colourless, odourless and tasteless and can only be measured using special equipment
Is gás gan dath, boladh ná blas é agus ní féidir é a thomhais ach amháin le fearas speisialta

When radon surfaces in the open air, it is quickly diluted to harmless concentrations, but when it enters an enclosed space, such as a house or other building, it can sometimes build up to unacceptably high concentrations

Nuair a thagann radón go barr talaimh amuigh faoin aer caolaítear é go scioptha go tiúchán gan dochar, ach nuair a thagann sé isteach i spás crioslaithe cosúil le teach nó foirgneamh eile, d'fhéadfadh sé amanna a mhéadú do thiúchán nach féidir glacadh leis
Radon from the ground enters buildings chiefly through cracks in floors or gaps around pipes or cables
Tagann radón ón talamh isteach i bhfoirgnimh go háirithe trí scoilteanna in úrláir, timpeall ar phíopaí nó cáblaí
Radon decays to form tiny radioactive particles, some of which stay suspended in the air
Lobhann radón go dtí míreanna beaga bídeacha agus fanann cuid acu ag foluain san aer
When these particles are inhaled into the lungs, they give a radiation dose that may damage cells in the lung
Nuair a ionálaítear na míreanna seo isteach sna scámhóga tugann siad miosúr radaíochta a d'fhéadfadh dochar a dhéanamh do chealla na scámhóg agus d'fhéadfadh ailse scamhóige a bheith mar thoradh air

Radon has been shown to be a cause of cancer, specifically lung cancer; prolonged exposure to elevated levels of radon gas in an enclosed area can be a contributory factor in increasing the risk of lung cancer, particularly where other factors such as cigarette smoking are involved

Tá sé cruthaithe go bhfuil radón ina chionsiocair le hailse, go háirithe ailse scamhóg; d’fhéadfadh nochtadh fadtéarmach do leibhéil arda gás radóin i limistéar iata a bheith ina shiocair bhreise le baol na hailse scamhóige a mhéadú, go háirithe má tá tosca eile amhail caitheamh tobac i gceist freisin
Read more in the World Health Organization’s factsheet; the joint position statement of the HSE and the Radiological Protection Institute of Ireland; and the National Radon Control Strategy (pdf)

Léigh tuilleadh i mbileog eolais na hEagraíochta Domhanda Sláinte; i gcomhráiteas seasaimh FSS agus na hInstitiúide Éireannaí um Chosaint Raideolaíoch (pdf) agus sa Straitéis Náisiúnta um Rialú Radóin (pdf)
EPA Office of Radiological Protection
Oifig um Chosaint Raideolaíoch

The Radiological Protection Institute of Ireland (RPII) merged with the Environmental Protection Agency on 1 August 2014 to become a fifth office in the EPA structure called the Office of Radiological Protection

Tá an Institiúid Éireannach um Chosaint Raideolaíoch (IÉCR) tar éis cumascadh leis an nGníomhaireacht um Chaomhnú Comhshaoil (EPA), agus is oifig í anois i structúr an EPA - an Oifig um Chosaint Raideolaíoch
This Office has regulatory, monitoring and advisory responsibilities in matters relating to ionising radiation
Tá freagrachtaí rialaithe, monatóireachta agus comhairle uirthi maidir le nithe a bhaineann le radaíocht ianaithe
It assesses radon levels and has identified those areas where high indoor radon levels are more likely to be found
Déanann sí leibhéil radóin a mheas agus tá na háiteanna sin sa tír is dóigh a bhfuil leibhéil arda radóin laistigh iontu aitheanta aici
The EPA publishes an interactive radon map
Foilsíonn an EPA léarscáil radóin idirghníomhach
You can enter an address to see if it is in a 'High Radon Area'
Is féidir leat seoladh a chur isteach agus féachaint an ‘Limistéar Ard-Radóin’ é
You can also view a table that summarises the results of the radon survey for each county since the early 1990s
Is féidir leat breathnú ar thábla ina bhfuil achoimre ar thorthaí an tsuirbhé radóin do gach contae ó na 1990í
The EPA's Radon in Homes booklet gives information about radon and the harm it can do, and describes how you can reduce your exposure to radon levels in the home

Tá eolas i Leabhrán faoi Radón i dTithe (Radon in Homes booklet) (pdf) an EPA ar radón agus ar an dochar a d’fhéadfadh sé a dhéanamh duit, agus tá cur síos ann ar na bealaí inar féidir an nochtadh do leibhéil radóin i do theach a laghdú
You can also view frequently asked questions about radon or use the queries form for other questions
Is féidir leat freisin breathnú ar cheisteanna coitianta faoi radón nó do cheist a chur ar an fhoirm seo, má tá ceist eile agat
There is also a series of radon factsheets on epa.ie and a video on testing your home for radon
Ina theannta sin, is ar fáil ar rpii.ie atá sraith de bhileoga eolais faoi radón agus físeán faoi do theach a thástáil i gcomhair radóin
The EPA recommends that all householders have their homes tested for radon
Molann an EPA go bhfaigheadh gach sealbhóir tí scrúdú le haghaidh radóin dá theach
It provides a radon measurement service, as do several private companies
Díreach mar a dhéanann roinnt cuideachtaí príobháideacha, cuireann an EPA seirbhís um thomhas radóin ar fáil
Rates for different testers may vary – the EPA charges about €56
D’fhéadfadh na rátaí athrú de réir an tástálaí - gearrann an EPA táille de thart ar €56
The testing is usually carried out by placing two small testing devices (detectors) in the house for 3 months
De ghnáth, déantar é seo trí dhá dheis bheag (brathadóirí) a chur sa teach ar feadh 3 mhí
At the end of this period, the detectors are sent back to the testing laboratory for processing
Ag deireadh na tréimhse seo, cuirtear na brathadóirí ar ais go dtí an saotharlann scrúdaithe le haghaidh próiseála
This procedure is carried out entirely by post
Déantar an próiseas uilig tríd an bpost
A 3-month measurement period is recommended because radon levels in a house can vary considerably from day to day as a result of changes in weather conditions, ventilation, building usage, etc
Moltar tréimhse scrúdaithe 3 mhí mar d'fhéadfadh léibhéil radóin i dteach a athrú go mór ó lá go lá mar gheall ar athruithe aimsire, aerú, úsáid an fhoirgnimh agus araile
The EPA's radon measurement service is confidential and it will not release the result of any measurement to anyone other than the person who originally requested the measurement
Seirbhís rúnda is ea an tseirbhís um thomhas radóin a chuireann an EPA ar fáil. Ní chuirfidh sí toradh aon tomhais in iúl do dhuine ar bith seachas an duine a d’iarr an tomhas sa chéad áit
If you find high radon levels
Má thagann tú ar ardleibhéil radóin
The level of radon is measured in becquerels per cubic metre – expressed as Bq/m^3 – and the national ‘reference level’ is 200 Bq/m^3
Is i mbeicireilí in aghaidh an mhéadair chiúbaigh – a chuirtear in iúl mar Bq/m^3 – a thomhaistear an leibhéal radóin. Is ionann an ‘leibhéal tagartha’ náisiúnta agus 200 Bq/m^3
The EPA recommends that you should consider taking action to reduce the level of radon in your home if the measurement is above this national reference level
Má tá an tomhas i do theach os cionn an leibhéil tagartha náisiúnta sin, molann an EPA gur chóir duit breithniú a dhéanamh ar ghníomh a dhéanamh an leibhéal radóin i do theach a laghdú
Steps that are taken to reduce the radon level are generally known as ‘radon remediation’
De ghnáth, tugtar ‘leasú radóin’ ar bhearta a dhéantar chun an leibhéal radóin a laghdú
There are two main methods of radon remediation – either by preventing radon entering your home from the ground underneath or by removing the radon after it has entered your home
Tá dhá phríomh-mhodh chun radón a leasú - trína chinntiú nach féidir le radón dul isteach i do theach ón talamh faoina bhun nó tríd an radón a bhaint tar éis dó dul isteach i do theach

No matter which method you choose, it is important to have your home re-tested after the work has been completed, to ensure that it has been successful in reducing the level in your home to below 200 Bq/m^3

Cibé modh a roghnaíonn tú, tá sé tábhachtach go ndéanfar do theach a thástáil arís tar éis an obair a chríochnú chun a chinntiú gur éirigh leis an obair an leibhéal radóin i do theach a laghdú go níos lú ná 200 Bq/m^3
The EPA provides a free post-remediation service to homeowners
Cuireann an EPA seirbhís iarleasaithe ar fáil saor in aisce d’úinéirí tí
Radon remediation works may qualify for the Home Renovation Incentive scheme
D’fhéadfadh go mbeadh oibreacha leasaithe radóin incháilithe don Scéim Dreasachta Athchóirithe Tí
You either apply and pay online for a radon measurement for your home, or you can download an application form for a radon measurement in the home and return it to the EPA with your payment
Is féidir leat foirm iarratais ar thomhas radóin i do theach a íoslódáil agus í chur ar ais chuig an EPA le d’íocaíocht
